adjective.description: Chemistry and Biochemistry"methylmalonic acid"noun a dicarboxylic acid isomeric with succinic acid, (CH₃)CH(COOH)₂.

Medicine"methylmalonic aciduria"noun the presence of an abnormally large amount of methylmalonic acid in the urine, especially as a manifestation of an inborn error of metabolism; an instance of this.
Medicine"methylmalonic acidaemia"noun any of several inherited metabolic disorders characterized by the presence of an abnormally large quantity of methylmalonic acid in the blood and urine.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From methyl + malonic, after German Methylmalonsäure methylmalonic acid.
